markdownRemark.html: The pedagogical use of emblems for women and children is interesting. Were these emblems ever disseminated (or re-purposed) with vernacular mottos/poems in woodcuts catering to a more rural audience? Or did these remain more or less exclusive to the urban bourgeoisie and landed aristocrats?
